tweet: (4/4) Abusive relationships also affect survivors‚Äô financial stability. And 40% of survivors said they had a partner who tried to get them pregnant against their will or stopped them from using birth control. Family planning gives women more choices to pursue education & careers.

(3/4) Such disruptions in women‚Äôs education and training dramatically impact their future earnings. @GeorgetownCEW found that earning a college degree increases women‚Äôs earnings by $427K for a 2yr degree and $822K for a 4yr degree (on avg over the course of their working lives).

(2/4) Lifetime costs of IPV are estimated at $103,767 for women. This includes the costs of health problems, lost productivity & criminal justice costs. In a recent study by @IWPResearch, 66% said an abusive partner had disrupted their ability to complete education or training.

(1/4) Today is International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women. It‚Äôs important to highlight the profound health, educational and economic consequences of intimate partner violence (IPV) and sexual assault on women survivors. https://twitter.com/Refugees/status/1198949455417839618¬†‚Ä¶
